bug.author: divrobot
bug.summary: ObjectDetection sample crash abort on mac os 10.10.4
bug.description:
Hi! I build opencv3.0.0 samples and run ObjectDetection ,but it crash abort with SIGABRT on CV_Assert( clEnqueueWriteBuffer(q, (cl_mem)u->handle, CL_TRUE, dstrawofs, total, alignedPtr.getAlignedPtr(), 0, 0, 0) >= 0 ); in OpenCLAllocator::upload function .when I delete eyes_cascade.detectMultiScale( faceROI, eyes, 1.1, 2, 0 |CASCADE_SCALE_IMAGE, Size(30, 30) ); in main ,the face detect ok, so I think if the haarcascade_eye_tree_eyeglasses.xml cause the bug. my computer is: MacBook Pro 2.2 GHz Intel Core i7, 16GB DDR3, Intel Iris Pro 1536 MB OS X 10.10.4 Makefile like this: <denchmark-code># CMAKE generated file: DO NOT EDIT! # Generated by "Unix Makefiles" Generator, CMake Version 3.2

# Special rule to run CMake to check the build system integrity. # No rule that depends on this can have commands that come from listfiles # because they might be regenerated. cmake_check_build_system: $(CMAKE_COMMAND) -H$(CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR) -B$(CMAKE_BINARY_DIR) --check-build-system CMakeFiles/Makefile.cmake 0 .PHONY : cmake_check_build_system </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: There have been a ton of fixes on the detection models and interfaces in the last 2 months. Afaik this problem has been solved by me and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Dikay900>@Dikay900</denchmark-link> before and thus this can be closed. All models work fine now in the latest branches.
Hi, Steven, I update Itseez/opencv master branch 10 minutes age , the bug exist yet.
Let me take a look at it :)
So both the model and the latest code branch seem to work properly.

Looks like that main reason of problem is OpenCL backend crash. This may be a reason of some incompatibilities related to OpenCL. If it is real reason of this problem then you can try to disable OpenCL:
use environment variable OPENCV_OPENCL_DEVICE=disabled call cv::ocl::setUseOpenCL(false); near main() function of your application during build via CMake parameter: -DWITH_OPENCL=OFF

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/alalek>@alalek</denchmark-link> that is true - updated my code to represent this. But on the other hand, if I did not build without OpenCL support (enabled by default and did not switch it off) then why does it work on my end?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/StevenPuttemans>@StevenPuttemans</denchmark-link> In case of build without OpenCL supports parameter for is ignored (this call has no effect): <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/blob/11b3529b39da84c57e58368babf32a5444ad8ba9/modules/core/src/ocl.cpp#L1497-L1504>https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/blob/11b3529b39da84c57e58368babf32a5444ad8ba9/modules/core/src/ocl.cpp#L1497-L1504</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/alalek>@alalek</denchmark-link> When I disable opencl the program run ok, looks is incompatibilities related to OpenCL in MAC OS as you said, think you

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/alalek>@alalek</denchmark-link> think you misunderstand, i got OpenCL enabled in my OpenCV3 installation. But I do not need to disable. So might be good to notice that this behaviour is ONLY on MacOSx and not in Linux Ubuntu 14.04. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/divrobot>@divrobot</denchmark-link> can you close then?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/StevenPuttemans>@StevenPuttemans</denchmark-link> Unfortunately there is no guarantee that OpenCL backend works fine . It is not related to specific OS. There are many reasons for this:
H/W issue driver issue OpenCL ICD issue OpenCV bug (we can provide fixes only here).
